# bock 𓃜 𓃝 𓃵 𓃶 𓃒 𓃘 buck https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/buck#Translations

𓊪 ≈ 𓎺 𓎻 𓐐 𓊸 "b" bucket 𓃜 bock ( Champollion )

𓃝 #bꜣ 𓃝𓊸 Ba bock 𓄆 / 𓄅 in 𓈙 𓆑 𓄆 σέβας awe, respect

𓃶 Old Irish boc, poc, pocc “he-goat” goat
𓃵 ibex bok Bock באָק ⇔ 𓃶 بکری bakrī બકરી bakrī بز bique bouc boz ແບ້ bǣ бож bož бжэн زِن bizin bžăn mbuzi imbuzi goat
𓃵 ibex > 𓇋 𓃀 𓏡 𓅱 𓃲

𓃶 bock < bank 𓋹 𓈖 𓐍 bonk

The wild BEZOAR ibex of the Zagros Mountains is the likely original ancestor of probably all domestic goats today.[6]

𓃝 كَبْش kabš sheep capre bock reverse

𓊃 𓂋 𓃝 the rambock 𓊃 𓂋 𓃝 zar ≈ •qar ≈ خروف xarūf 𓃀𓃝 #bꜣ Schafbulle Schafbock sheep bull

bock > αἴξ ?
𓃵 ibex bok Bock באָק بکری bakrī બકરી bakrī بز bique bouc boz ແບ້ bǣ бож bož бжэн زِن bizin bžăn mbuzi imbuzi

𓃶 αἴξ mauz مَاعِز māʿiz עֵז ez āzis ožka ožys эчки eçki ئۆچكە öchke echki өшкү öşkü

𓃾 α al'byk : der Bock “bull” Proto-Slavic *bykъ. Proto-Turkic *buka “bull” bika буга
⇔ bucêt “to sound, to buzz” Latvian bukti “to moo” bukas “bittern” Welsh bugad “lowing, bellowing”

𒁍 bock

𒁍 buᵏ byk *bykъ “bull” bock 𓃒

𒁍𒄩𒇻 pu-ḫa-lu •bock'l
𒁍𒄩𒇻 male animal, stud

𒁍𒄩𒁺 pu-ḫa-du
𒁍𒄩𒁺 lamb ⇔ πhe goat

𒁍𒃵𒌅 bu-qam-tu
𒁍𒃵𒌅 ewe lamb

𒁍 buᵏ 𒂊𒁍 e-pu to bake

𒁍𒇷𒇻 buᵏ-li-lu
𒁍𒇷𒇻 boxthorn berry

𒁍𒇻 bu-lu
𒁍𒇻 animals, livestock ⇔ poly

𒁍𒇻 •puᵏ-ru pecuāria “livestock”
𒁍𒇻 bu-ru livestock პირუტყვი ṗiruṭq̇vi 𓄛 ṭq̇vi tier
𒁍𒇻 bu-ru livestock بهايم bhāyim 𐎁𐎅𐎎𐎚 bhmt 𓏠
𒁍𒇻 bu-lu livestock бы́дла býdla bétail
𒁍𒇻 bu-lu livestock bestiar bestie beast
𒁍𒇻 bu-lu livestock búfé

𒉺 paʳ ⇔ 𒁍 púʳ
